MappingCharFilter",      "name": "phone_char_mapping",      "mappings": [        "-=>",        "(=>",        ")=>",        "+=>",        ".=>",        "\\u0020=>"      ]    }  ]ﾉExpand tableTokenizersﾉExpand tableToken filters will filter out or modify the tokens generated by the tokenizer. Onecommon use of a token filter is to lowercase all characters using a lowercase token filter.
Another common use is filtering out stopwords such as the, and, or is.While we don't need to use either of those filters for this scenario, we'll use an nGramtoken filter to allow for partial searches of phone numbers.JSONThe nGram_v2 token filter splits tokens into n-grams of a given size based on theminGram and maxGram parameters.
For the phone analyzer, we set minGram to 3 because that is the shortest substring weexpect users to search. maxGram is set to 20 to ensure that all phone numbers, even withextensions, will fit into a single n-gram.The unfortunate side effect of n-grams is that some false positives will be returned.
